tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
"Problems are only opportunities in work clothes."
—Henri Kaiser

Are you ready to convert every challenge into an opportunity for success?
Do you have what it takes to crack the “Ultimate Management Event” ?
Show off your savvy managerial skills and win BIG, in Chaos Theory!

tabs.title: Format
tabs.content:
ROUND 1: Written
The first round is an aptitude test. It is designed to test your problem solving ability, logical and critical thinking, managerial skills and creativity.

ROUND 2:

The second round is further divided into 3 sub rounds such that one member of the team will participate in each sub round (hence, teams with three members are mandatory). The members will have to participate individually in this round, with each member not participating in more than one sub round. The result will be the cumulative result of the performances of the members in each sub round.

ROUND 3:
The third round is a total Chaos Management round. The teams are given a problem a problem statement for which optimum solution must be delivered.

tabs.title: Rules
tabs.content:
» Each team must consist of exactly 3 members.
» All students must have a valid k! ID to participate.
» There is no restriction on number of teams per college.
» The members of a team can be from different colleges.
» Any form of cheating is STRICTLY PROHIBITED. If found cheating, the team will be instantly disqualified.
» The decisions of the judges will be final and binding. Objections to the results will not be entertained.

» The participants are requested to be formally dressed for Round 3.

tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
If the stakes are high, make 'em buy!

Well, in this event, all you've got to do is sell!
The biggest magnates these days are  the ones that are "magnets" in the literal sense.
If you think you know your way around the business world, the skills to convince someone into your business and the ability to be quick and witty, this surely is the thing for you!!

tabs.title: Format
tabs.content:
» Marketing Madness is a team event which whirls around four rounds.
» The first round will be a written test which will trigger your managerial aptitude and current business trends.
» The second,third and final round are designed in a way to check out every aspect of marketing and the format will be explained on spot by the organisers.

tabs.title: Rules
tabs.content:
» Each team should consist of 4 participants.

»The members of a team can be from different colleges/institutions.

» Each member should have  a unique k! ID to participate in the event.
» Anyone found in the act of malpractices will be restrained from further participation in the event.

» The participants are requested to be dressed formally for Round 3.

tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
"Torture the data until it confesses."                                                                                                                                                      

The amount of data an organisation receives is reaching  unprecedented levels. Now that we’ve data, all we need to know is how to decipher it to uncover the hidden patterns, correlations and find useful information to make better decisions. This is the event which tests your thinking pattern, decision making skills, team work, and how you handle data!

tabs.title: Format
tabs.content:
ROUND 1:

This round will test your basic thinking capacity and analysing skills.

ROUND 2:

This round will test how you think and what you think.

» Reason-out: given a set of data, you’ll have to find out how and why it happened.

» Adopt a strategy: given a problem, you’ll have to find a strategy which will give the best solution.

ROUND 3:

This round will test all your skills (thinking capacity, communication skills, presentation and money making skills) .You’ll have to form a business idea from the given set of data.

tabs.title: Rules
tabs.content:
» This is a team event, with three members per team.

» You’ll be eliminated when you fail to exceed the expectations.

» The participants are requested to be formally dressed for Round 3.

tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
“Price is what you pay; value is what you get. Whether we’re talking about socks or stocks, I like buying quality merchandise when it is marked down”

- Warren Buffet

If bringing solution is your job, then creating the problem is my job.

Solve the problems I challenge you with and take the crown with you.

If challenging your grey matter isn't your strong suit, you can still prove yourself.

Do you support a worthy innovation?  If yes, you play the role of buttress for an erudite innovation and I play the role of Mae West at your swimming hours in the ocean of golden treasury.

Make sure that you get closer to this event and I promise that you will get your wallet filled.

tabs.title: Format
tabs.content:
Participants can participate either as business teams or as the audience.

ROUND 1:

The first round is an online round. The registered participants should participate only as business teams. Problem statement is available in the next tab. Teams with creative and feasible ideas will be promoted to the next round.

ROUND 2:

Round 2 is divided into five sub rounds. It takes place on the spot along with audience as passive participants. Real life problem statements will be offered to the business teams for which they are supposed to put their ideas forth and place their shares in the stock market.

The audience shall place their shares for the attractive ideas in the stock market. It is to be noted that the audience can place any number of shares for any number of teams. Results will be displayed after the end of every sub round. The mode of evaluation for business teams and the audience will be revealed on the spot.

tabs.title: Problem Statement
tabs.content:
XYZ Inc. is one of the top enterprises coming out with flying colours in a variety of fields. Client events are the key to their driving revenue. They host conferences and other events that feature expert speakers on key issues in the industry. These events help them to attract prospective new clients and also to retain their existing clients. Unfortunately, they noticed that the event attendance dropped by almost 15% in the last year and that customer retention also dropped during that time period. So the company has decided to bring either a new product to the market or to make innovative changes to their existing ones. At this time you have been given a role of Business development manager along with two additional members to ensure that no attendance drop takes place this time and also the product becomes a successful one.

» Explain the idea of your product.

» What makes your product different from other products? 

» Who will be your audience?

» How is your business going to make money?

» How will you promote your business (Innovative means of promotion) ?

Mail your TDPs to kwallet@kurukshetra.org.in.

» The deadline for submitting the TDPs is extended to 12th February, 2016.

tabs.title: Rules
tabs.content:
» Audience must be individual participants.

» Each business team must have three members.

» The members of a team can be from different colleges/institutions.

» All the participants should have a valid k! ID.

» No contestant can be a member of more than one team.

» No member of a business team can participate as audience and vice versa.

» The participants are not allowed to bring any additional material.

» Participants involved in any kind of malpractice will be immediately disqualified.

» The decisions of the judges will be final and binding.

» The participants are requested to dress formally for Round 2.
